adverbs.description: absurdly (comparative more absurdly, superlative most absurdly)

entries.meaning: In an absurd fashion. [First attested in the mid 16th century.]
examples: Absurdly, he concluded his oration with a song.

entries.meaning: To an extreme degree. [First attested in the mid 16th century.]
examples: The critics were absurdly extravagant with their praise.
